intro: Anthotium humile, commonly known as the small anthotium, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, which is characterized by its unique inflorescence structure consisting of a spadix and spathe. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually arrow-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Anthotium humile produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered around the spadix, which is enclosed by a colorful, leaf-like structure called the spathe.
